programme.title: Women's Canoe (C1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session includes the Semi-Finals for Women's Canoe Slalom . The races took place at Nautical St. White Water, Paris, on 31/07/24.

programme.title: The Vault: Helen Glover, Paris 2024 Costumes, Olympic Refugee Boxer
programme.desc: British rowing sensation Helen Glover comes to The Vault to donate her kit from Paris 2024 and recounts her incredible come back while being a mum of two. Jeannette unveils the incredible costumes from the Paris 2024 ceremonies. Rob stumbles on one of the most precious and largest items of the collection, a two-men rowing scull from Paris 1924 and discovers the surprising story of the unknown French boy who was the coxswain.

programme.title: Semi-Finals & Finals - Day 5 | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session includes the Semi-Finals for the Men's 200m Backstroke, the Women's 200m Butterfly, and the Women's 200m Breaststroke. It also includes the Finals for the Men's 100m Freestyle, Men's 200m Breastsroke, Women's 1500m Freestyle, Men's 200m Butterfly and the Women's 100m Freestyle. The races took place at Paris La Defense Arena, on 31/07/24.

programme.title: Meet the young US swimmer who broke Michael Phelps’ record
programme.desc: Carson Foster is one the world’s fastest young swimmers. At the age of 10, he broke one of his idols records: Michael Phelps.

programme.title: Sarah Sjostrom, Sweden’s Swimming Superstar | Splash In
programme.desc: When Sarah slipped and broke her elbow a few months before Tokyo 2020, her fans thought she may not even compete at the Olympics. She fought back, accelerated the recovery, and ended up winning silver in the 50 free. She currently holds 5 World Records and is eyeing Paris 2024 to add new achievements. Soundtrack: Mabel, Let Them Know

programme.title: Men's Individual Time Trial | Cycling Road | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Men's Individual Time Trial took place at Pont Alexandre III on the 27/07/24. Remco Evenepoel (BEL) won the Gold Medal, Filippo Ganna (ITA) won the Silver Medal, and Wout Van Aert (BEL) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: How recovery sparks hope for last "off-limits" town of Fukushima
programme.desc: Born and raised in Futaba, Olympic cyclist Kazunari Watanabe embarks on a personal journey to visit his home town for the first time since the earthquake.

programme.title: Men's Individual All-Around Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's All-Around Artistic Gymnastics Final took place on 31/07/2024 at the Bercy Arena, Paris. Shinnosuke Oka (JPN) claimed the Gold, Boheng Zhang (CHN) took the Silver, and Ruoteng Xiao (CHN) the Bronze.

programme.title: USA-ITA - Women's Foil Team Gold Medal | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Gold Medal match took place at Grand Palais, Podium Piste, on 01/08/24. Final score The United States of America 45:39 Italy.

programme.title: Running in North Korea | Film
programme.desc: A new Original documentary that captures the incredible journey of Aimee Fuller and Mirjam Jaeger as they travel to Pyongyang to participate in the 2019 Mangyongdae Prize International Marathon and meet fellow Olympians from the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea.

programme.title: Women's Individual All-Around Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Individual All-Around Final took place at Bercy Arena on 01/08/2024. Simone Biles won Gold (USA), Rebeca Andrade Silver (BRA) and Sunisa Lee (USA) Bronze.

programme.title: Simone Biles: The Comeback Queen | Wait For It Paris 2024
programme.desc: Simone Biles defied the odds in Paris. A comeback for the ages. Team gold, three individual medals and a vault no woman had ever landed before.

programme.title: What moves me | Samir Ait Said: Finding strength in pain
programme.desc: Samir Ait Said, French artistic gymnast, suffered a severe leg injury at Rio 2016. Through a difficult comeback, while also dealing with the loss of his father, he shares the emotional journey he has been on in the last four years. From long rehabilitation to a painful mourning, he never gave up his Olympic dream and managed to find strength from his pain.

programme.title: Men's 50m Rifle 3 Positions Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 50m Rifle 3 Position Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 01/08/24. Yukun Liu (CHN) won Gold with a total of 463.6 points, Serhiy Kulish (UKR) won Silver, and Swapnil Kusale (IND) won Bronze.

programme.title: India’s Top Pistol Shooter Manu Bakher | Jee Jan Se
programme.desc: Throughout her childhood and teenage years, Manu Bakher switched sports half a dozen times. When she started practicing air pistol shooting, she knew this was the one for her. This is her amazing story.

programme.title: Double Sculls, Fours, Eights, Single Sculls | Rowing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session took place at Nautical St - Flat Water, France, on 01/08/24.
At the Women's Double Sculls Final, Gold was claimed by Team New Zealand, Team Romania won Silver, and the Bronze went to Team Great Britain.
At the Men's Double Sculls Final, Team Romania won Gold, Team Netherlands calimed Silver, and Team Ireland completed the podium, with the Bronze.
At the Women's Four Final, it was Gold for Team Netherlands, Silver for Great Britain, and Bronze for New Zealand.
At the Men's Four Final, Gold was claimed by Team USA, the Silver by Team New Zealand, and the Bronze by Team Great Britain.

programme.title: The Vault: Helen Glover, Paris 2024 Costumes, Olympic Refugee Boxer
programme.desc: British rowing sensation Helen Glover comes to The Vault to donate her kit from Paris 2024 and recounts her incredible come back while being a mum of two. Jeannette unveils the incredible costumes from the Paris 2024 ceremonies. Rob stumbles on one of the most precious and largest items of the collection, a two-men rowing scull from Paris 1924 and discovers the surprising story of the unknown French boy who was the coxswain.

programme.title: Men's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Men's Layak K1 Final took place on day six of the Olympic Games Paris 2024 at Stade d'eau vive Vaires-sur-Marne on August 1, 2024 in Paris, France.
Giovanni de Gennaro (ITA) won first place, Titouan Castryck (FRA) won second place and Pau Echaniz (ESP) took third place.

programme.title: France’s Tony Estanguet I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of France’s three-time gold medallist Tony Estanguet, who is now leading the Paris 2024 team.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -78kg, Men's -100kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Women's -78kg and Men's -100kg Finals took place on 01/08/2024 at the Champ-de-Mars Arena, Paris.
At the Women's -78kg, Alice Bellandi (ITA) claimed the Gold medal, Inbar Lanir (ISR) won the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Patricia Sampaio (POR) and Zhenzhao Ma (CHN).
At the Men's -100kg, Zelym Kotsoiev (AZE) won the Gold medal, Ilia Sulamanidze (GEO) took the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Muzaffarbek Turoboyev (UZB) and Peter Paltchik (ISR).

programme.title: Israeli duo working hard to achieve Olympic dream
programme.desc: Linoy Ashram and Raz Hershko are two of Israel's leading junior athletes seeking to join the nation's Olympic squad.

programme.title: Men's 200m Backstroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 200m Backstroke was held on 01/08/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Hubert Kos (HUN) claimed Gold with a time of 1:54.26, Apostolos Christou (GRE) took Silver and Roman Mityukov (SUI) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 200m Breaststroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 200m Breastroke was held on 01/08/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Kate Douglass (USA) claimed Gold with a time of 02:19.24, Tatjana Smith (RSA) took Silver and Tes Schouten (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x200m Freestyle Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 4x200m Freestyle Relay was held on 01/08/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Australia claimed Gold with an Olympic record time of 07:38.08, United States of America took Silver and China completed the podium.

programme.title: On the Line: Swimming
programme.desc: Discovering other names, stories and anecdotes behind the mythical Olympic Finals of swimming

programme.title: USA-ITA - Women's Foil Team Gold Medal | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Gold Medal match took place at Grand Palais, Podium Piste, on 01/08/24. Final score The United States of America 45:39 Italy.

programme.title: Women's 10m Air Rifle Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10m Air Rifle Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 29/07/24. Hyojin Ban (KOR) won Gold with a total of 251.8. Yuting Huang (CHN) won Silver, and Audrey Gogniat (SUI) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x400m Relay Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 4x400m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. The United States of America won Gold with a time of 3:15.27, the Netherlands won Silver and Great Britain completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 4x400m Relay Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 4x400m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. The United States of America claimed Gold with a new Olympic Record time of 2:54.43mins., Botswana took Silver and Great Britain completed the podium.

programme.title: Olympic State of Mind | Allyson Felix’s Motivation to succeed
programme.desc: Family is the only motivation needed for six-time gold medallist and American track star, Allyson Felix.

programme.title: Julien Alfred’s outfit is a symbol of national pride | The Vault
programme.desc: Jeannette and Rob bump into a collection of objects from Paris 2024. They discover the kit of Julien Alfred, the sprinting sensation who surprised everyone by winning the 100M final and bringing home the first ever gold medal for Saint-Lucia. Her outfit is the national flag featuring the blue of the sea, the yellow of the sun and the black for the volcanic mountains. We meet Julien on the island. She has overcome many personal challenges, including her father's passing, to achieve global superstardom. Her 100m gold and 200m silver medals at the Olympics have brought immense pride to her island nation, and her iconic kit now in the Museum stands as a symbol of her historical success.

programme.title: Before There Were Starting Blocks: a History of Olympic Sprint | The Vault
programme.desc: Join Jeanette to explore the evolution of the Olympic sprint. From digging into dirt in Athens 1896 to bold personal techniques before the introduction of wooden blocks and the revolutionary Tartan track.

programme.title: The Vault: Helen Glover, Paris 2024 Costumes, Olympic Refugee Boxer
programme.desc: British rowing sensation Helen Glover comes to The Vault to donate her kit from Paris 2024 and recounts her incredible come back while being a mum of two. Jeannette unveils the incredible costumes from the Paris 2024 ceremonies. Rob stumbles on one of the most precious and largest items of the collection, a two-men rowing scull from Paris 1924 and discovers the surprising story of the unknown French boy who was the coxswain.

programme.title: The Vault: Matthias Steiner, Olympic timekeeping, Sky Brown, Dream Team
programme.desc: Weightlifting legend Matthias Steiner comes to The Vault to share his incredible stories and discover his kit on display at the Olympic Museum for the first time. Sky Brown who donated her skateboard shares her emotion in winning a medal at Tokyo 2020. Jeannette discovers the magic eye camera from London 1948 while Rob finds Michael Jordan’s iconic shoes from Barcelona 1992 which leads him to an unexpected “other dream team” story linking the Olympic and the Grateful Dead.

programme.title: Mixed Relay Final | Triathlon | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Mixed Relay Triathlon Final took place at Pont Alexandre III on August 5, 2024 in Paris, France. Germany claimed Gold, United States Silver, and Great Britain completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's Final | Triathlon | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Men's Triathlon Final took place on day five of the Olympic Games Paris 2024 at Pont Alexandre III on July 31, 2024 in Paris, France.
Alex Yee (GBR) won Gold, Hayden Wilde (NZL) won Silver and Leo Bergere (FRA) won Bronze.

programme.title: Niklas Kaul - medal contender for Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Despite an incredible 2019 season, winning gold at the World Championships and setting a world’s best record, decathlete Niklas Kaul from Germany faced challenges at Tokyo 2020 due to an injury sustained in the high jump event. After focusing on recovery and preparing for future competitions, he reached an impressive 4th place at the European Championships in Roma, which puts him back in a position to medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Leonardo Fabbri’s success is rooted in family support | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: From his early athletic beginnings to his emotional 22.34m throw, Leonardo's journey is marked by family support and a dream of Olympic success. Despite setbacks, his determination remains unshaken as he aims for glory at Paris 2024. The Tuscan shot putter won gold at the European Championships, setting a championship record and placing him as a serious contender for the coming games.

programme.title: Michael: No rest on the road to Olympic gold | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Take a look inside Michael Norman’s rigid routine as he prepares to redeem himself with an Olympic gold in the 400m distance at Paris 2024 this summer. While he is visiting his first track and field community, with family and fiancee all behind him, the American sprinter is dedicated to excellence.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Women's 1500m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 1500m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. Faith Kipyegon (KEN) won Gold with an Olympic Record time of 3:51.29 minutes. Jessica Hull (AUS) won Silver and Georgia Bell (GBR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 5000m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 5000m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. Jakob Ingebrigtsen (NOR) won Gold with a time of 13:13.66 minutes. Ronald Kwemoi (KEN) won Silver, and Grant Fisher (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 100m Hurdles Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Hurdles Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. Masai Russell (USA) won Gold with a time of 12.33 seconds. Cyrena Samba-Mayela (FRA) won Silver and Jasmine Camacho-Quinn completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 800m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 800m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. Emmanuel Wanyonyi (KEN) won Gold with a time of 1:41.19 minutes. Marco Arop (CAN) won Silver and Djamel Sedjati (ALG) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 400m Hurdles Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 400m Hurdles Final took place at Stade de France, on 09/08/24. Rai Benjamin (USA) won Gold with a time of 46.46 seconds. Karsten Warholm (NOR) won Silver and Alison dos Santos (BRA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 10,000m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10,000m Final took place at Stade de France, on 09/08/24. Beatrice Chebet (KEN) won Gold with a time of 30:43.25 minutes. Nadia Battocletti (ITA) won Silver and Sifan Hassan (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: The Vault: Helen Glover, Paris 2024 Costumes, Olympic Refugee Boxer
programme.desc: British rowing sensation Helen Glover comes to The Vault to donate her kit from Paris 2024 and recounts her incredible come back while being a mum of two. Jeannette unveils the incredible costumes from the Paris 2024 ceremonies. Rob stumbles on one of the most precious and largest items of the collection, a two-men rowing scull from Paris 1924 and discovers the surprising story of the unknown French boy who was the coxswain.

programme.title: The Vault: Matthias Steiner, Olympic timekeeping, Sky Brown, Dream Team
programme.desc: Weightlifting legend Matthias Steiner comes to The Vault to share his incredible stories and discover his kit on display at the Olympic Museum for the first time. Sky Brown who donated her skateboard shares her emotion in winning a medal at Tokyo 2020. Jeannette discovers the magic eye camera from London 1948 while Rob finds Michael Jordan’s iconic shoes from Barcelona 1992 which leads him to an unexpected “other dream team” story linking the Olympic and the Grateful Dead.

programme.title: Women's 400m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 400m Final took place at Stade de France, on 09/08/24. Marileidy Paulino (DOM) won Gold with an Olympic Record time of 48.17 seconds. Salwa Eid Naser (BRN) won Silver and Natalie Kaczmarek (POL) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 4x100m Relay Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 4x100m Relay final took place at Stade de France, on 09/08/24. Canada won Gold with a time of 37.50 seconds. South Africa won Silver and Great Britain completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x100m Relay Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 4x100m Relay final took place at Stade de France, on 09/08/24. The United States of America won Gold with a time of 41.78 seconds. Great Britain won Silver and Germany completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 110m Hurdles Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 110m Hurdles Final took place at Stade de France, on 08/08/24. Grant Holloway (USA) won Gold with a time of 12.99 seconds. Daniel Roberts (USA) won Silver, and Rasheed Broadbell (JAM) completed the podium.

programme.title: Final Women's 400m Hurdles | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 400m Hurdles Final took place at Stade de France, on 08/08/24. Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone (USA) won Gold with a World Record time of 50.37 seconds. Anna Cockrell (USA) won Silver, and Femke Bol (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Final Men's 200m | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 200m Final took place at Stade de France, on 08/08/24. Letsile Tebogo (BOT) won Gold with a time of 19.46sec. Kenneth Bednarek (USA) took Silver, and Noah Lyles (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Body+ (Film)
programme.desc: Meet the inspiring athletes who are redefining what it means to have the perfect body.

programme.title: Men's High Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's High Jump Final took place at Stade de France on the 10/08/24. Hamish Kerr (NZL) won the Gold medal, Shelby McEwen (USA) won the Silver medal and Mutaz Essa Barshim (QAT) won the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: Women's 20km Race Walk Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This event took place on 01/08/2024 around Trocadéro. YANG (CHN) claimed the Gold, Perez (ESP) Silver and Montag (AUS) completed the podium
